pullRequest.title: Prohibit the usage of create index api in namespaces managed by data stream templates
pullRequest.bodyText:
This commit adds validation that prohibits the creation of regular indices
in the namespace of templates with data streams enabled.
It shouldn't be possible to create ordinary indices when the name of the index
matches with a composable index template that enables data streams. Auto creation
has logic that creates data streams instead of regular indices. However validation
logic for the create index api was missing.

commit.message:
Prohibit the usage of create index api in namespaces managed by data stream templates.

This commit adds validation that prohibits the creation of regular indices
in the namespace of templates with data streams enabled.

It shouldn't be possible to create ordinary indices when the name of the index
matches with a composable index template that enables data streams. Auto creation
has logic that creates data streams instead of regular indices. However validation
logic for the create index api was missing.
adjust test to not match with default stack template

nodes.bodyText: I think we should try to steer the user in the right direction, can we suggest they try the create data stream API in the error message?
